definition: to sound a bell/(of a clock) to chime
to hit/to strike/to tap/to rap/to knock/to rip sb off/to overcharge
clock/o'clock/time as measured in hours and minutes/bell/CL:架[jia4],座[zuo4]
handleless cup/goblet/to concentrate/variant of 鐘|钟[zhong1]

sentences.english: Bellringing is what I'm good at though.
The sexton therefore took him into his house, and he had to ring the church bell.
sentences.chinese: 于是司事就将老二带走了，让他在教堂敲钟。

sentences.english: To mark the day, a priest conducts a special bell pulling performance using three bells.
sentences.chinese: 为了表示这一天，牧师带领一场用三口钟的敲钟表演。

sentences.english: But that may just be the three Jacks “hammering the bells to separate the quarters from the minutes.”
sentences.chinese: 不过那只是“整刻点敲钟”的三个敲钟人。

sentences.english: But that may just be the three Jacks “hammering the bells to separate the quarters from the minutes.”
sentences.chinese: 不过那只是“整刻点敲钟”的三个敲钟人。

sentences.english: Many of the people who ring the bell are business executives whose companies trade on the exchange.
sentences.chinese: 许多敲钟的人是商界高管，他们公司的股票在此交易。

sentences.english: You! Bell ringer! What are you doing down here?
sentences.chinese: 你，敲钟人，在下面干什么？

sentences.english: In his family, everybody used to be a bell ringer !
sentences.chinese: 他们家族中一代一代的都是敲钟人。

sentences.english: Because I can pull, I'll toll the bell.
sentences.chinese: 因为我能拉牦，我将会来敲钟。

sentences.english: Lots of bell ringers were killed by lightning.
sentences.chinese: 许多敲钟人被闪电击毙。

sentences.english: The church bell used to be rung to signify disaster.
sentences.chinese: 以前发生灾祸时教堂都要敲钟。

sentences.english: A blind hermit rings the hour.
He rang the bell for school assembly.
One fine day, while the bellringer was ringing his bells, the bishop approached him and said.
sentences.chinese: 一个晴天，敲钟人在敲钟时，主教走过来对他说。

sentences.english: One fine day, while the bellringer was ringing his bells, the bishop approached him and said.
sentences.chinese: 一个晴天，敲钟人在敲钟时，主教走过来对他说。

definition: abbr. for 紐約證券交易所|纽约证券交易所[Niu3 yue1 Zheng4 quan4 Jiao1 yi4 suo3]
to sound a bell/to raise the alarm

pinyin: Niu3 yue1 Zheng4 quan4 Jiao1 yi4 suo3

definition: (of a store, stock market etc) to open for trading/to make the first transaction of the day
Shenzhen Stock Exchange, abbr. to 深交所[Shen1 Jiao1 suo3]
pinyin: Shen1 zhen4 Zheng4 quan4 Jiao1 yi4 suo3
Shang4 hai3 Zheng4 quan4 Jiao1 yi4 suo3
shou3 ci4 gong1 kai1 zhao1 gu3

definition: lit. to hang up a plate/to open up for business/listed (on stock market)
